UMC has employed properly technical and organizational security measures (e.g. setting access permission) in accordance with the applicable laws to prevent your personal data from being accidentally or intentionally damaged, lost, tampered with, unauthorized disclosure, unauthorized access, and other illegal or unauthorized processing.

UMC endeavours to take reasonable steps to ensure that the personal data processed by the company is accurate and correct. If there is any inaccurate in your personal data, the company will correct or erase it immediately.

UMC endeavour to take reasonable steps to ensure that the scope of the company's processing of your personal data is reasonably related to the purposes set out in this policy, and only within that scope.

non_compliant.section: In order to respond to the legal changes and the needs of UMC's business execution, UMC will modify this policy from time to time.

non_compliant.amend: It is recommended to be more specific and state what might change in the privacy policy and how it will impact individuals' rights. For example, UMC could state that it will inform users of any changes to the purposes of processing their data.

non_compliant.amend: UMC should carefully assess whether all the listed data points under "Expertise and social information" are truly necessary for the specified purposes of processing. If not, UMC should limit the collection and processing of this data to what is strictly required.

non_compliant.amend: UMC should specify the purposes for which consent is obtained and ensure that the consent is freely given, specific, informed and unambiguous. This includes providing clear and separate consent requests for each processing purpose.

non_compliant.section: Because of the public nature of the Internet, information transmitted over the internet is not completely secure. non_compliant.article numbers: 13 (Information to be provided where personal data are collected from the data subject), 21 (Right to object)
non_compliant.legal provisions:
Where personal data are processed for direct marketing purposes, the data subject shall have the right to object at any time to processing of personal data concerning him or her for such marketing, which includes profiling to the extent that it is related to such direct marketing.  

**Amend**:  Clarify the right to object to processing based on legitimate interests (Article 6(1)(f)) or public interest (Article 6(1)(e)).  The policy should state that individuals have the right to object to such processing and that processing should cease unless the controller demonstrates compelling legitimate grounds for the processing which override the interests, rights and freedoms of the data subject or for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims.
non_compliant.amend: In light of the compliance with applicable laws, you have the right to object to a third party who processes your Personal Data on behalf of UMC.  You have the right to object to processing, including profiling, where UMC is relying on legitimate interest or public interest as the legal basis for processing.  If you object, UMC will no longer process your personal data unless we can demonstrate compelling legitimate grounds for the processing which override your interests, rights and freedoms or for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims.
